intro: Ericameria nauseosa, commonly known as bitterleaf rabbitbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flower heads that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert environments. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance and a distinct bitter taste. Ericameria nauseosa is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
